channel.title: How do I set the VM's in KVM to read-only?
channel.description:
The wiki says to do it in the gui, but I don't see where to change it to read only. Thanks.
Edit: I tried this and it seemed to work. sudo virt-xml Whonix-Workstation --edit --disk readonly=on
Is there any way I can confirm?

item.title: How do I set the VM's in KVM to read-only?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
View -> Details -> VirtIO Disk 1 -> Check: Read-only

David888:

Is there any way I can confirm?

Create a new file in your home dir then reboot (assuming you were already booted in the live mode from the boot menu) then restart the VM. You shouldn;t see it anymore.

Make sure you read the wiki page on precautions before you use it for best results.

Whonix – 16 Aug 20

Anti-forensics Precautions when using Whonix ™ VMs in Live Mode

Minimize what is written to the hard drive when using Whonix ™ VMs in Live Mode.
